articles.title: The striker from England's eighth tier hoping to face Salah at Afcon
articles.summary: Macauley Bonne plays for Maldon & Tiptree in England's eighth tier, but is going to Afcon with Zimbabwe.

articles.title: How Rogers and Villa exposed Man Utd defence
articles.summary: Match of the Day pundit Dion Dublin analyses what went wrong for Manchester United against Aston Villa, and Wayne Rooney discusses the World Cup potential of "man of the moment" Morgan Rogers.

articles.title: January transfer window: Key dates and Deadline Day
articles.summary: The transfer window re-opens on Thursday January 1, allowing clubs across the leagues to seek reinforcements and reshape their squads.

articles.title: New Zealand secure West Indies Test series win after five Duffy wickets
articles.summary: Jacob Duffy took 5-42 as New Zealand bowled out the West Indies for 138 on a deteriorating fifth-day pitch to win the third Test by 323 runs and take the three-match series 2-0.

articles.title: 'Fighter' Rogers shows importance as Villa stay in title race
articles.summary: Morgan Rogers shows his importance to Aston Villa with two goals in a win over Manchester United, as Unai Emery's side remain in the title hunt.

articles.title: 'Hearts have arrived'... but McInnes warns they can get better
articles.summary: Hearts "have arrived" as Scottish Premiership title contenders after beating Rangers for the second time this season, says Kris Boyd.

articles.title: Stunning Rogers double secures Villa win over Man Utd
articles.summary: Morgan Rogers scores twice for Aston Villa in their 2-1 win against Manchester United, extending Villa's unbeaten run to 10 matches in all competitions.

articles.title: Man City to weigh players before Forest game
articles.summary: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says his players will be weighed when they return to training to check they are fit enough to play against Nottingham Forest.

articles.title: 'Not at end of storm, but light amid darkness for Nancy at Celtic'
articles.summary: On the winter solstice, some light finally illuminated the darkness of Wilfried Nancy's opening 17 days as Celtic manager.

articles.title: Chelsea hammer nine goals past Liverpool in Women's League Cup
articles.summary: Chelsea put nine past Liverpool in the Women's League Cup to progress to the semi-finals, as Sam Kerr scores the opening two goals and Johanna Rytting Kaneryd completes a hat-trick.

articles.title: The best team today lost - Amorim
articles.summary: Manchester United Manager Ruben Amorim says that Manchester United performed better despite losing 2-1 to Aston Villa.

articles.title: Emery elated with 'fantastic' Aston Villa win
articles.summary: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery praises his "fantastic" players in a hard-fought 2-1 win against Manchester United.

articles.title: Can Aston Villa sustain a title challenge?
articles.summary: Football Focus's Alex Scott, Nedum Onuoha and Glenn Murray look at Aston Villa's incredible Premier League form and whether they can sustain a title challenge this season.

articles.title: Chelsea put nine past Liverpool in Women's League Cup
articles.summary: Chelsea hammer Liverpool 9-1 to reach the Women's League Cup semi-finals, while Manchester City, Manchester United and Arsenal also progress.

articles.title: West Ham set to appoint Guarino as manager
articles.summary: West Ham are set to appoint Rita Guarino as their women's team manager following the sacking of Rehanne Skinner.

highlights.title: Premier League highlights this week - Week Highlights

articles.title: 'What's his problem?' Suljovic bats away slow-play claims as Cullen fumes at 'cheating'
articles.summary: Mensur Suljovic has denied intentionally provoking Joe Cullen during their World Darts Championship clash, with the Englishman describing his pace of play as like "cheating" and "not darts".

articles.title: Highlights: Littler gets the job done in tough contest against Davies
articles.summary: Highlights of the World Darts Championship second- round match between Luke Littler and David Davies.
